messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Digest Number 3438
messages.msgSnippet: I choose unschooling because it works best. Janis ... From: Paula Sjogerman To: Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com Sent: Wednesday, May 07, 2003 6:23 PM
messages.messageBody:
I choose unschooling because it works best.
Janis
----- Original Message -----
From: Paula Sjogerman
To: Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com
Sent: Wednesday, May 07, 2003 6:23 PM
Subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Digest Number 3438


on 5/7/03 10:05 AM, Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com at
Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com wrote:

> I guess I wondered if people chose unschooling because they had kids
> who weren't interested in reading until they were ten or eleven and
> who were more bodily-kinesthetic learners or spatial learners or
> whatever.


Nope. My oldest reads more than anyone. Really. I'll pit her against anyone.
She didn't read super early, right at six, but she reads in a freakily fast
way. And gets everything.

I would unschool any kid with any learning style because that's what
unschooling IS - creating the space for your kids to learn in whatever way
they do.

Paula
